problems_solutions.problem: AI voice agents sound too robotic and ask too many questions at once
problems_solutions.solution: Use 6th grade English level and limit responses to 1-2 sentences max

problems_solutions.problem: AI model APIs crashing during high demand periods
problems_solutions.solution: Choose reliable, available AI models over trendy ones

startup_ideas.idea: Voice AI agents for industry-specific negotiations
startup_ideas.business_model: SaaS platform for voice AI automation
startup_ideas.validation: Test with specific industries like luxury goods, real estate, etc.

mistakes_to_avoid.mistake: Making AI ask all questions at once in the first interaction
mistakes_to_avoid.consequences: Sounds obviously AI and disengages the human caller
mistakes_to_avoid.prevention: Keep responses to 1-2 sentences max, ask questions naturally
mistakes_to_avoid.example: Alex initially would 'ram every single question down throat within first turn'

mistakes_to_avoid.mistake: Using complex language in voice AI
mistakes_to_avoid.consequences: Shorter call durations and less human-like interactions
mistakes_to_avoid.prevention: Use 6th grade English level for all AI responses
mistakes_to_avoid.example: Most phone conversations happen at 6th grade English level

mistakes_to_avoid.mistake: Relying on trendy AI models during hype cycles
mistakes_to_avoid.prevention: Choose stable, available models over popular ones
mistakes_to_avoid.example: DeepSeek crashed during hype cycle, bot stopped responding

growth_tactics.tactic: Scale phone-based business processes with voice AI

ai_workflows.use_case: Automated negotiation for luxury watch purchases

metrics_kpis.benchmark: Longer durations indicate more human-like interaction
metrics_kpis.optimization_tip: Use 6th grade English level to increase duration

metrics_kpis.benchmark: AI should respond to all caller inputs
